column1: '''Shirrifs''' were the sole law enforcement officials in [[the Shire]] and the main branch of the [[Watch]]. Since in the Shire law was based solely on common sense and ancient tradition
column2: it was not broken. It was the Shirriffs' job to protect the Shire from trespassers more than anything. There were a total of twelve in all of the Shire
column4: and they were distinguished from "civilians" by a feather worn in their caps.<ref>{{FR|Ordering}}</ref>

column1: The only time this number was any larger was from two circumstances. The first
column4: where [[Hobbits]] were deputized into patrolling the borders

column1: The second was when [[Saruman]] had infiltrated the Shire
column3: with the help of [[Ruffians|ruffians]] like [[Bill Ferny]]. Saruman had increased the number to suppress any revolts
column4: and arrest anybody who broke the rules. They were assigned in companies such as the [[First Eastfarthing Troop]]
column5: though that was not enough to prevent [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]]

column1: Shirriff is an archaic rendition of "sheriff". Both mean "shire-reeve" ([[Old English]] ''scīrgerefa''). The archaism was made to make the connection to [[the Shire]] more obvious.
Shirriff is supposed to be a translation of a [[Hobbitish]] word
column2: derived from their former language related to [[Rohan language|Rohirric]]
